title: Uniform Commercial Code
context: ยง490:2A-211 Warranties against interference and against infringement; lessee&rsquo;s obligation against infringement. (a) There is in a lease contract a warranty that for the lease term no person holds a claim to or interest in the goods that arose from an act or omission of the lessor, other than a claim by way of infringement or the like, which will interfere with the lessee&rsquo;s enjoyment of its leasehold interest. (b) Except in a finance lease, there is in a lease contract by a lessor who is a merchant regularly dealing in goods of the kind, a warranty that the goods are delivered free of the rightful claim of any person by way of infringement or the like. &copy; A lessee who furnishes specifications to a lessor or a supplier shall hold the lessor and the supplier harmless against any claim by way of infringement or the like that arises out of compliance with the specifications. [L 1991, c 40, pt of ยง1]
